meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - It's Time to Get Your Paws On Cat Quest!

Oh boy, are you ready for some fur-bulous fun? Because I'm diving into the whimsical world of Cat Quest, and it's a purr-fectly delightful adventure! As a seasoned (okay, maybe not that seasoned) grog video game reviewer, I'm thrilled to share my paws-itive thoughts on this feline-filled RPG.

First off, let me tell you - Cat Quest is the cat's pajamas! The visuals are as cute as a kitten in a tutu, and the solid RPG action has me hooked. The charming adventure follows your feline protagonist (who looks suspiciously like my cat, Mr. Whiskers) on a quest to rescue her mom from the clutches of evil. Sounds like a classic tale, right?

Now, I know what you're thinking - "Is it just for cat lovers?" Fear not, non-feline fanatics! Cat Quest is all about accessible fun, making it perfect for players of all ages and skill levels. It's an ideal little RPG to introduce youngsters (and the young at heart) to the world of RPGs. The script is filled with delightful puns that'll have you giggling like a kitten on a catnip high.

Now, let's get to those pesky critics! *wink* I mean, our fellow reviewers. Worth Playing gave it 78 points, praising the solid action and charming adventure. Nintendo Life scored it 70, saying it's functional but might not be for everyone (dog lovers, take note!). SpazioGames gave it 60, noting that its mobile origins make it a bit simplistic. Nintendo World Report also scored it 70, calling it a fun romp with a straightforward action RPG style.

God is a Geek loved it, giving it 80 points and saying it's perfect for newcomers and veterans alike who love cats. Cubed3 gave it 70, highlighting its adorable script and kitties, but cautioning that some might find the difficulty spikes challenging. Digitally Downloaded scored it 60, stating that while it's not a game they'll remember beyond its charm, it's still a fun adventure.

So, what's my take? Well, I think Cat Quest is a purr-fectly delightful experience that's sure to put a smile on your face (or at least make you chuckle at the cat puns). It might not be the most complex RPG out there, but it's a great little adventure that's easy to pick up and play in short or long sessions.

In conclusion, if you're ready for some lighthearted fun with cats, Cat Quest is the game for you! Just remember - don't worry if it gets a bit repetitive; just skip along like my Mr. Whiskers when he chases laser pointers

Time to get your paws on Cat Quest!
